title: FR:  Automatic Sort as an inheritable setting on containers
author: IcebergTitanic
body_snippet:
<!--

<!-- Feature Request -->
I would like for a container to have an automatic sort flag that could be inherited by other containers below it. Perhaps three possible values:  None, A-Z, Z-A
<!-- If you file a feature request, please delete the bug section...

iterations.description: This is a clear usability enhancement that extends existing manual tree sorting with per-container inherited behavior.
Automatic Sort already exists as a container setting with inheritable `InheritAutoSort` behavior, persistence support, and test coverage, so this issue duplicates existing functionality.

comments.author: IcebergTitanic
comments.snippet: Yes, I understand this is more than a simple flag setting to be added as it would presumably involve some kind of automatic sorting mechanism that would need to be triggered rather than being manually performed by the user as it currently is.

notes:
AI triage (codex): This is a clear usability enhancement that extends existing manual tree sorting with per-container inherited behavior.
Approach: Add an inheritable AutoSort flag on container nodes and invoke existing sort routines on child add/rename/move events, with regression tests for inheritance and automatic reordering.
AI triage (codex): Automatic Sort already exists as a container setting with inheritable `InheritAutoSort` behavior, persistence support, and test coverage, so this issue duplicates existing functionality.
Approach: Close as duplicate/already implemented and reference the existing AutoSort + inheritance behavior.
